intro: Craterostigma ndassekerense, commonly known as the Namibian rock cress, is a flowering plant native to Namibia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and hairy stems, adapted to thrive in arid environments. It typically grows in rocky soils and is found in the Namib Desert region. Due to its unique adaptations, it is of interest to botanists studying desert flora.
